oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Anyonic statistics of quantum impurities in two dimensions
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Yakaboylu, Enderalp
Lemeshko, Mikhail
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Condensed Matter - Quantum Gases
Condensed Matter - Mesoscale and Nanoscale Physics

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We demonstrate that identical impurities interacting with a two-dimensional many-particle environment obey anyonic statistics. In particular, we find that due to the many-body interactions between the impurities and the bath, each of the impurities can be viewed as a flux-tube-charged-particle composite described by fractional "dressed" statistics. This amounts to a novel configuration with emerging anyons, which is fundamentally different from the previously studied fractional quantum Hall and Kitaev model settings. The proposed setup paves the way to realizing anyons using electrons interacting with superfluid helium or lattice phonons, as well as using atomic impurities in ultracold gases.
